channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Bitcoin hashrate recovers after big freeze shuts down miners
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The Bitcoin network hashrate has returned to 241.29 EH/s after a temporary 38% fall to 170.60 EH/s from a weekly peak of 276.40 EH/s.

item.title: Women who made a contribution to the crypto industry in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elizabeth Gail
item.description: 2022 saw greater inclusivity and participation of women in the crypto and blockchain industries.

item.title: French investors sued Binance for over 2.4 million euros in losses
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Binance France and Binance Holdings Limited are being sued over alleged misleading commercial practices and fraudulent concealment.

item.title: Time in the market: Ways to approach crypto investing in 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arunkumar Krishnakumar
item.description: After a challenging year, should investors still consider investing in crypto in 2023?

item.title: CZ addresses reasons behind Binance's recent FUD
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Binance's FUD is primarily caused by external factors - not by the exchange itself, according to CZ.

item.title: Crypto is a nonexistent asset for big institutional investors - JPMorgan exec
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The asset class volatility still poses a challenge to money managers, noted JPMorgan's head of institutional portfolio strategy.

item.title: Bitcoin and these 4 altcoins are showing bullish signs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin’s volatility could soon pick up and that may boost buying interest in ETH, TON, XMR, and OKB.

item.title: BTC price foregoes Santa rally as Bitcoin volatility hits record low
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin has never been so boring, according to the Bitcoin historical volatility index, as Christmas 2022 offers nothing for BTC bulls or bears.

item.title: What are Handshake (HNS) domains, and how do they work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Deer
item.description: HNS aims to provide a decentralized alternative to the traditional domain name system (DNS) — here’s how.

item.title: 1inch launches Fusion upgrade to improve swap security and profitability
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: As a decentralized trading and matching system, the 1inch Swap Engine connects DeFi users and provides liquidity for crypto trades through professional market makers.

item.title: The 5 most important regulatory developments for crypto in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The European Union has its regulatory framework, while the race is only kicking off in the United States.

item.title: What are reflection tokens and how do they work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: Reflection tokens allow holders to earn passive returns from transaction fees by simply holding onto their assets.

item.title: DeFi flash loan hacker liquidates Defrost Finance users causing $12M loss
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Moments after a few users complained about the unusual loss of funds, Defrost Finance’s core team member Doran confirmed that Defrost V2 was hit with a flash loan attack.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried found ‘chilling’ in JFK airport lounge on $250M bail bond
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Based on the pictures, crypto community members confirmed that SBF’s location was the Greenwich (Business Class) lounge in American Airlines’ Terminal 8.

item.title: SBF sent home, FTX heads plead guilty, and Binance gets Voyager assets: Hodler’s Digest, Dec. 18-24
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Editorial Staff

item.title: What is an NFT whitelist, and how can you join one?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jagjit Singh
item.description: A whitelist is a list of wallet addresses with priority access to an NFT collection before making it available to the general public.

item.title: Crypto billionaires lost $116B since March: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The loss represents the collective personal equity of 17 people in the space, including 15 who have lost over half of their fortunes since March.

item.title: Blockware sued over alleged misrepresentation of miners’ performance
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The plaintiff claims losses of $250,000 and seeks compensatory and punitive damages.

item.title: Crypto can get weird: The 5 strangest stories of the industry in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Francisco Rodrigues
item.description: Filmmakers are interested in documenting one of this year’s weirdest stories in crypto, but what else made the list?

item.title: Xmas dinner table: What to tell your family about what happened in crypto this year
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Christmas dinner could get awkward for crypto advocates who were adamant about their families investing last year — Cointelegraph compiled a small recap of what happened in crypto this year.

item.title: BTC price levels to watch as Bitcoin limps into Christmas under $17K
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: The lack of volatility speaks volumes, as one analyst argues that Bitcoin is only worth investing in below $12,000 or above $19,000.

item.title: FTX paid $12M retainer to a New York law firm before bankruptcy filing
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Sullivan & Cromwell LLP (S&C), a law firm headquartered in New York City, received $12 million from West Realm Shires Services Inc. on behalf of FTX for legal services.

item.title: Public Bitcoin mining companies plagued with $4B of collective debt
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: The Bitcoin mining community took up massive loans during the 2021 bull market, negatively impacting their bottom lines during a subsequent bear market.

item.title: Judge pulls out of SBF-FTX case citing husband’s law firm’s advisory link
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Judge Abrams’ withdrawal from the FTX case eradicates any conflict of interest in the FTX case because Andres continues to serve as a partner at Davis Polk & Wardwell, a law firm that advised FTX in 2021.

item.title: Santas and Grinches: The heroes and villains of 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Shiraz Jagati
item.description: Here’s a list of the 12 individuals who had the most impact — for better or worse — on the crypto industry this past year.

item.title: Economic frailty could soon give Bitcoin a new role in global trade
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joseph Bradley
item.description: Aggressive interest rate hikes have wrought havoc on global markets. As a consequence, more countries may embrace Bitcoin in the year ahead.

item.title: US delays crypto tax reporting rules, as it still can’t define what a ‘broker’ is
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Congress passed a law in November 2021 that required the new crypto rules to be issued.

item.title: 2 executives of crypto exchange AAX arrested in Hong Kong: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The former CEO of AAX, Liang Haoming, and the founder of AAX, Thor Chan, were arrested on Dec. 23.

item.title: Bridge attacks will still pose major challenge for DeFi in 2023 — Security experts
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Hackers have stolen over $2.5 billion through vulnerabilities on cross-chain bridges in the past two years.

item.title: LastPass attacker stole password vault data, showing Web2’s limitations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: LastPass users with weak master passwords may need to change the individual passwords they stored with the service.
